column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Five more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 933 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday
column5: 658 on Tuesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.As of Wednesday
column7: the number of positive cases confirmed in the past seven days was 12
column9: there were 329 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column10: up from 317 on Tuesday.There were also 38 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column11: up from 35 on Monday.Last updated 8 December at 14:45 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3
column13: 534 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Wednesday.Of those
column16: 512 of the jabs were first doses
column20: 723 were third doses.The remainder were booster jabs.Last updated 8 December at 14:45 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column23: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.Another 5
column24: 590 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Tuesday.There are 505 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in the Republic of Ireland
column25: down from 536 on Monday.Some 117 of those are in intensive care units
column26: up from 110 on Monday.Last updated 7 December at 17:30 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column28: 096 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Monday.A total of 3
column30: 471 people have had their first dose and 3
column32: 103 have had their second dose.A total of 1
column34: 656 booster jabs had been administered as of Monday.Last updated 7 December at 17:30 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
